cost_protocol.usage: While doing the cost operation on the bundle, this IGP will be used

cost_threshold_percent.description: Traffic utilization threshold percentage (in decimal format) to check cost process. For example 0.7 means 70%
cost_threshold_percent.usage: If the parameter is set to 0.7, cost out operation is considered successful if the traffic falls to less than 70% of the previous traffic on the augmented bundle ethernet interface that is part of the IGP. Similarly, cost in is considered successful if traffic grows to more than 70% of the previous traffic for the augmented bundle ethernet interface which is part of IGP.

rtr1_host.usage: Of the two routers that are selected for the playbook, choose one of the router for this parameter

proc_id.description: OSPF process id on which cost operation needs to be performed, when using ospf protocol
proc_id.usage: Applicable if IGP is "ospf". Bundle should be part of "ospf" instance with this process id

rtr2_host.usage: Of the two routers that are selected for the playbook, choose the other router for this parameter

rtr1_interfaces.description: Interface to be added to the bundle on router1
rtr1_interfaces.usage: Interfaces specified for this parameter will be added to the Bundle ether on the first router

rtr2_interfaces.description: Interface to be added to the bundle on router2
rtr2_interfaces.usage: Interfaces specified for this parameter will be added to the Bundle ether on second router

rtr1_bundle_id.usage: On first router, bundle ether with this id will be cost out, capacity augmented by adding interface(s) and then cost in

rtr2_bundle_id.usage: On second router, bundle ether with this id will be cost out, capacity augmented by adding interface(s) and then cost in

bw.description: Expected bandwidth (in kbps) of bundle post addition of interface
bw.usage: This value is used as a part of post-check operation.  The bandwidth of the bundle should be >= the value specified for this input parameter for the playbook to be verified

provider.description: Provider to be used to connect to the router

collection_type.description: Collection type to be used for data collection

mop_timeout.description: Timeout duration for MoP i.e. maximum time spent in Running/Paused states. e.g. 900s, 10m, 1.5h, etc. Valid time units are 'ns', 'us' (or 'Âµs'), 'ms', 's', 'm', 'h'.
